Package com.cafean.moviegen

Class ZipSourceStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cafean.moviegen.ZipSourceStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javax.media.Controls, javax.media.protocol.Controls, javax.media.protocol.PullBufferStream, javax.media.protocol.SourceStream
    public class ZipSourceStream
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.media.protocol.PullBufferStream
    ZipSourceStream provides the media data used during video export and playback.

    • Method Detail

      • getTimeStamps

        public double[] getTimeStamps()
        Gets the time stamps from the original animation.
        Returns:
        double array containing the timestamps extracted from the animation frames' filenames.

      • willReadBlock

      • flushStream

        public void flushStream()
        Reset the stream. Fundamentally similiar to a full 'rewind' in this particular case.

      • setRenderDimensions

        public void setRenderDimensions​(int width,
                                int height)
        Sets the adjusted dimesions to which all images in the stream will be resized. If these values are not multiples of WIDTH_FACTOR and HEIGHT_FACTOR, they will be taken to the closest multiple less than the current value. Note that these values do not have to match the original aspect ratio of the images in the stream.
        Parameters:
        width - the new width for the resized images.
        height - the new height for the resized images.

      • getMovDimensions

        public java.awt.Dimension getMovDimensions()
        Gets the original (adjusted) dimensions.

        public boolean advanceFrame()
        Advance the rendering one frame.
        Returns:
        True if the frame is advanced and rendered. False otherwise.

        Indicates if the opened file is invalid.

      • seekToFrame

        public boolean seekToFrame​(int frame)
        Seeks to a given frame. The requested frame must be within the bounds of the startTimeIndex and the endTimeIndex.
        Parameters:
        frame - The desired frame.
        Returns:
        True if the frame is found and rendered. False otherwise.

      • writeRGB

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage writeRGB​(java.io.File file)
                                      throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a media chunk into the provided file as raw RGB data. Use the endOfStream() method to determine if this method can be called.
        Parameters:
        file - a File specifying the location to which RGB information will be saved. Note that writing the RGB information is performed in append mode for multiple writes.
        Returns:
        a BufferedImage of RGB data for the currently converted SVG
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • writeRGB

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage writeRGB​(java.io.File file,
                                             boolean writeToFile)
                                      throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a media chunk into the provided file as raw RGB data. Use the endOfStream() method to determine if this method can be called.
        Parameters:
        file - a File specifying the location to which RGB information will be saved. Note that writing the RGB information is performed in append mode for multiple writes.
        writeToFile - determines if the RGB data should be written to file. (the BufferedImage may be the only desired data)
        Returns:
        a BufferedImage of RGB data for the currently converted SVG
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • read

        public void read​(javax.media.Buffer buf)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Reads a media chunk into the provided buffer. If null is provided in the buffer's place, it renders the next frame to the attached SvgPanel. Use the endOfStream() method to determine if this method can be called.
        Specified by:
        read in interface javax.media.protocol.PullBufferStream
        Parameters:
        buf - javax.media.Buffer object in which to read the next frame of the animation. read will always attempt to render the next frame onto the attached SvgPanel; provide null for buf to obtain only this rendering.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • decodeTimeStamp

        public static final double decodeTimeStamp​(java.lang.String fileName)
                                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Extracts a time stamp from a given file name. Throws an exception if the filename cannot be parsed. The expected format is: "Step_" followed by six digits for the frame number followed by a single "-", followed by the timestamp (arbitrary length), followed by "s.svg". Sample filename: Step_000043-133.42s.svg
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getFramerate

        public double getFramerate()
        Gets the framerate.

      • setEndTimeIndex

        public boolean setEndTimeIndex​(int index)

      • getEndTimeIndex

      • setTimeFactor

        public void setTimeFactor​(double timeFactor)
        Set the real-time multiplier for exported video.
        Parameters:
        timeFactor - Real-time multiplier for the exported video.

      • closeProgressDialog

        Closes a registered ProgressDialog. Returns safely if no dialog is defined.
